title: FC Vostok
text:
FC Vostok (, "Vostok Fýtbol Klýby") was a <a href="Kazakhstan">Kazakh</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> club from <a href="Oskemen">Oskemen</a> (Ust-Kamenogorsk), and a founding member of the <a href="Kazakhstan%20Premier%20League">Kazakhstan Premier League</a> in 1992. The club's best finish in the league was 5th place in 1997 and again in 1998.
History.
On 19 September 2008, <a href="FC%20Shakhter">FC Shakhter</a> and FC Vostok were found guilty of one count of <a href="match%20fixing">match fixing</a>. Coaches and management involved were banned from football for 60 months and both clubs were expelled from the <a href="Kazakhstan%20Premier%20League">Kazakhstan Premier League</a> On 2 October 2008, the <a href="Football%20Federation%20of%20Kazakhstan">Football Federation of Kazakhstan</a> revised these decisions. FC Vostok's expulsion was upheld, while <a href="FC%20Shakhter">FC Shakhter</a>'s punishment was reduced to a deduction of nine points. The result of the fixed match was annulled, and all remaining Vostok games were to be counted as won 3–0 by their opponents. However, the expulsion of FC Vostok from the <a href="Kazakhstan%20Cup%202008">Kazakhstan Cup 2008</a> was revoked.
A new club, <a href="FC%20Altai%20Semey">FC Altai Semey</a>, was founded in January 2016 from the merger of FC Vostok and <a href="FC%20Spartak%20Semey">Spartak Semey</a>.
